Using GIS for invasive species research Anthony Davidson 2019-09-02 1 Overview This respository contains a collection of dynamic programming tools and introductory tutorials for mapping/GIS from the following github repositories: Creating maps in R: A textbook on geocomputational analysis in R : and other supporting documents ranging from blogs to scientific publications coming below… 1.1 The objectives generally the objective is to create a landing page and resource of GIS work in R with a particular focus on invasive species dynamics. The current goals under my PhD work is as follows: 1.1.1 One Produce static maps for the first publication of my PhD. Draft here. Datasets Grid locations are in a csv file called "" Outline of NZ here "" Forest vegetation here "" Data from landCare 2019 publication here "" Rcode My attempt so far "" GIS cheat "" Powerpoint cheat "" Static maps NZ beech forest dynamics 8 grids full data only 6 used South Island of NZ 1.1.2 Two Produce static maps for the following data-set (Davidson2019b) same as above 1.1.3 Three Produce static maps for the following data-set (Davidson2019c) same as above 1.2 Resources Vignettes Creating maps in R "" Book vignettes "" My developing docs "" Examples LandCare 2019 publication here "" Software This is the absolute minimum you need to start a bookdown book.
